info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 06 at 3:06PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 345 PM MST... At 306 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Camp Creek, or 17 miles north of Scottsdale, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsdale, Cave Creek, Carefree, McDowell Mountain Park, Desert Mountain, Camp Creek, Rio Verde, Horseshoe Reservoir and Seven Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
